job_title: Admissions Counselor in Banner Elk, NC
pros: Time off Health benefits Flexible schedule
The location is beautiful and there are some decent faculty and staff, but most are quick to leave because they realize how poorly the college is ran and become burnt out quickly.
cons:
The current president (Lee King) is absolutely unqualified to be running an institution. He has never served in a faculty position, so he doesn't understand the challenges of a truly undergraduate faculty face day-to-day. He often makes knee-jerk reactions, with no sense of faculty input or governance, and is too focuses on creating the appearance of improvements to the college instead doing the hard work of improving faculty and staff morale and compensation, connection with the community, and providing professional development. 

Many of the faculty of the college at this college are either burnt out or unqualified, often times teaching below the standards and with lackluster energy, but because of the limited system of review and evaluation (there is no tenure system at this institution), they slide past for decades. Other times the administration just ignores issues of low pedagogy standards because the pay is so low, if someone is willing to show up to work, that is enough. 

In the current president's time with the college, he has replaced five VPs (soon to be six, I've heard), often replacing them with friends. He not only allows individuals to hire their family in positions, but he himself has his wife serving as his secretary on a temporary basis, even though she has been there for over a year. 

I worked for this institution for nearly eight years and sadly can't recommend it to anyone, unless your desperate or using it as a stepping stone to a better position. With the lack of mentorship and faculty development, combined with low compensation and an unqualified administration, I would be surprised if this college keeps its accreditation and still is in operation in the next 10-15 years.
